title: Oughtonhead Common Walking Route

images.title: OLU, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath on Oughtonhead Common, near to Ickleford, Hertfordshire, Great Britain. Beside the river Oughton.

images.title: OLU, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Oughton at Oughtonhead Common. From the Hertfordshire Countryside Magazine, April 1967:- "The Lucas family was closely associated with Oughton Head and owned much of the land around the common. William Lucas in his diary tells of his favourite walk out over Gaping Hills to Orton (sic) Head; Samuel Lucas drew and painted the countryside and birds; and Francis Lucas wrote poems which reflect the scene of fields and woods around and the men who worked them."

images.title: Martin / Waterfall at Oughtonhead Common Nature Reserve
images.caption: Waterfall at Oughtonhead Common Nature Reserve. Man made waterfall on the River Oughton just along from the dog paddling pool!

images.title: OLU, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bridge and seat on Oughtonhead Common. The bridge allows access across a tributary of the River Oughton and forms part of a network of footpaths on the common.

description: This walk takes you around the Oughtonhead Common Nature Reserve in Hitchin . There's some nice trails along the River Oughton, pockets of woodland, meadows and lots of wildlife to look out for on the way. Keep your eyes peeled for kingfishers on the river and the Orange Tip butterflies around the pretty wildflower meadows in the warmer months. It's a lovely peaceful place for a stroll with plenty of benches to sit and relax on too. You can start the walk from the car park on the eastern side of the common at the Swinbourne Avenue playing fields. Then head west and then north to meet up with the riverside trails. To extend your walk you could pick up the Icknield Way Path and follow it north west to visit the nearby village of Pirton.
